turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: We can't do that, Dude.  That fucks up our plan.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well call them up and explain it to 'em, Walter!  Your plan is so fucking simple, I'm sure they'd fucking understand it!  That's the beauty of it Walter!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Wooden bridge, huh?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I'm throwing the money, Walter! We're not fucking around!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The bridge is coming up!  Gimme the ringer, Dude!  Chop-chop!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Fuck that!  I love you, Walter, but sooner or later you're gonna have to face the fact that you're a goddamn moron.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Okay, Dude.  No time to argue.  Here's the bridge--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Your wheel, Dude!  I'm rolling out!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What the fuck?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Your wheel!  At fifteen em-pee-aitch I roll out!  I double back, grab one of 'em and beat it out of him!  The uzi!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uzi?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You didn't think I was rolling out of here naked!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, please--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Aitz chaim he, Dude.  As the ex used to say.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What the fuck is that supposed to mean?  What the fuck're we gonna tell Lebowski?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?  Oh, him, yeah.  Well I don't see, um-- what exactly is the problem?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?  The problem is--what do you mean what's the--there's no--we didn't-- they're gonna kill that poor woman--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What the fuck're you talking about? That poor woman--that poor slut-- kidnapped herself, Dude.  You said so yourself--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No, Walter!  I said I thought she kidnapped herself!  You're the one who's so fucking certain--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's right, Dude, 1  % certain--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, what'm I gonna tell Lebowski?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I told that fuck down at the league office-- who's in charge of scheduling?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Who gives a shit, Walter?  What about that poor woman?  What do we tell--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: C'mon Dude, eventually she'll get sick of her little game and, you know, wander back--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, and in the meantime what do I tell Lebowski?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Saturday is shabbas.  Jewish day of rest.  Means I don't work, I don't drive a car, I don't fucking ride in a car, I don't handle money, I don't turn on the oven, and I sure as shit don't fucking roll!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: That's it.  I'm out of here.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: For Christ's sake, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: But Walter, we didn't make the fucking hand- off!  They didn't get, the fucking money and they're gonna-- they're gonna--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah yeah, "kill that poor woman."

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Who's got a fucking million fucking dollars parked in the trunk of our car out here?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: "Our" car, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: And what do they got, Dude?  My dirty undies.  My fucking whites--Say, where is  the car?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You don't know, Walter?  You seem to know the answer to everything else!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hmm.  Well, we were in a handicapped spot.  It, uh, it was probably towed.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It's been stolen, Walter!  You fucking know it's been stolen!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well, certainly that's a possibility, Dude--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Aw, fuck it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That wasn't her toe.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Whose toe was it, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: How the fuck should I know?  I do know that nothing about it indicates--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: The nail polish, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Fine, Dude.  As if it's impossible to get some nail polish, apply it to someone else's toe--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Someone else's--where the fuck are they gonna--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You want a toe?  I can get you a toe, believe me.  There are ways, Dude.  You don't wanna know about it, believe me.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: But Walter--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'll  get  you  a  toe by  this afternoon--with nail  polish. These fucking amateurs.   They send us a toe, we're  supposed to  shit our- selves with fear.  Jesus Christ. My point is--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: They're gonna kill her, Walter, and then they're gonna kill me--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well that's just, that's the stress talking, Dude.  So far we have what looks to me like a series of victimless crimes--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What about the toe?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: FORGET ABOUT THE FUCKING TOE!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Lady, I got buddies who died face- down in the muck so you and I could enjoy this family restaurant!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: All right, I'm leaving.  I'm sorry ma'am.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Don't run away from this, Dude! Goddamnit, this affects all of us!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I figure my only hope is that the big Lebowski kills me before the Germans can cut my dick off.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Now that is ridiculous, Dude.  No one is going to cut your dick off.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Thanks Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Not if I have anything to say about it.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, thanks Walter.  That gives me a very secure feeling.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: That makes me feel all warm inside.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Now Dude--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: This whole fucking thing--I  could be sitting here with just pee-stains on my rug.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: They're nihilists.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: They kept saying they believe in nothing.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Nihilists!  Jesus.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: And let's also not forget--let's not forget, Dude--that keeping wildlife, an amphibious rodent, for uh, domestic, you know, within the city-- that isn't legal either.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What're you, a fucking park ranger now?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No, I'm--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Who gives a shit about the fucking marmot!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: --We're sympathizing here, Dude--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Fuck your sympathy!  I don't need your sympathy, man, I need my fucking Johnson!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: He lives in North Hollywood on Radford, near the In-and-Out Burger--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: The In-and-Out Burger is on Camrose.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Near the In-and-Out Burger--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Who the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Who the fuck is Arthur Digby Sellers?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Who the f--have you ever heard of a little show called Branded, Dude?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: All but one man died?  There at Bitter Creek?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah yeah, I know the fucking show Walter, so what?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Fucking Arthur Digby Sellers wrote 156 episodes, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The bulk of the series.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Not exactly a lightweight.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: And yet his son is a fucking dunce.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah, go figure.  Well we'll go out there after the, uh, the.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Fuck me, man!  That kid's already spent all the money!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hardly Dude, a new 'vette?  The kid's still got, oh, 96 to 97 thousand, depending on the options.  Wait in the car, Donny.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Is this your homework, Larry?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Look, man, did you--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude, please!. . .  Is this your homework, Larry?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Just ask him if he--ask him about the car, man!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Is this yours, Larry?  Is this your homework, Larry?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Is the car out front yours?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Is this your homework, Larry?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: We know it's his fucking homework, Walter!  Where's the fucking money, you little brat?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Look, Larry. . . Have you ever heard of Vietnam?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Oh, for Christ's sake, Walter!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You're going to enter a world of pain, son.  We know that this is your homework.  We know you stole a car--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: And the fucking money!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: And the fucking money.  And we know that this is your homework, Larry.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, if you're there, pick up the fucking phone.  Pick it up, Walter, this is an emergency.  I'm not--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, listen, I'm at my place, I need you to come pick me up--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I can't drive, Dude, it's erev shabbas.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Erev shabbas.  I can't drive.  I'm not even supposed to pick up the phone, unless it's an emergency.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It is a fucking emergency.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I understand.  That's why I picked up the phone.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: THEN WHY CAN'T YOU--fuck, never mind, just call Donny then, and ask him to--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude, I'm not supposed to make calls--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: WALTER, YOU FUCKING ASSHOLE, WE GOTTA GO TO PASADENA!  COME  PICK ME UP OR I'M OFF THE FUCKING BOWLING TEAM!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I mean we totally fucked it up, man. We fucked up his pay-off.  And got the kidnappers all pissed off, and the big Lebowski yelled at me a lot, but he didn't do anything.  Huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well it's, sometimes the cathartic, uh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I'm saying if he knows I'm a fuck- up, then why does he still leave me in charge of getting back his wife? Because he fucking doesn't want her back, man!  He's had enough!  He no longer digs her!  It's all a show! But then, why didn't he give a shit about his million bucks?  I mean, he knew we didn't hand off his briefcase, but he never asked for it back.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What's your point, Dude?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: His million bucks was never in it, man!  There was no money in that briefcase!  He was hoping they'd kill her!  You throw out a ringer for a ringer!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Shit yeah!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Okay, but how does all this add up to an emergency?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm saying, I see what you're getting at, Dude, he kept the money, but my point is, here we are, it's shabbas, the sabbath, which I'm allowed to break only if it's a matter of life and death--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, come off it.  You're not even fucking Jewish, you're--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You're fucking Polish Catholic--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about? I converted when I married Cynthia! Come on, Dude!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, and you were--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You know this!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: And you were divorced five fucking years ago.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah?  What do you think happens when you get divorced?  You turn in your library card?  Get a new driver's license?  Stop being Jewish?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: This driveway.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm as Jewish as fucking Tevye

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It's just part of your whole sick Cynthia thing.  Taking care of her fucking dog.  Going to her fucking synagogue.  You're living in the fucking past.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Three thousand years of beautiful tradition, from Moses to Sandy Koufax-- YOU'RE GODDAMN RIGHT I LIVE IN THE PAST!   I--Jesus.  What the hell happened?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: AS IF WE WOULD EVER DREAM OF TAKING YOUR BULLSHIT MONEY!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You thought Bunny'd been kidnapped and you could use it as a pretext to make some money disappear.  All you needed was a sap to pin it on, and you'd just met me.  You thought, hey, a deadbeat, a loser, someone the square community won't give a shit about.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's all over, man!  We call your fucking bluff!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: WALTER, FOR CHRIST'S SAKE!  HE'S CRIPPLED!  PUT HIM DOWN!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sure, I'll put him down, Dude.  RAUSS! ACHTUNG, BABY!!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh, shit.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: He can't walk, Walter!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah, I can see that, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, you fuck!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shit, Dude, I didn't know.  I wouldn't've done it if I knew he was a fucking crybaby.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: We're sorry, man.  We're really sorry.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sure you'll see some tank battles. But fighting in desert is very different from fighting in canopy jungle.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I mean 'Nam was a foot soldier's war whereas, uh, this thing should be a fucking cakewalk.  I mean I had an M16, Jacko, not an Abrams fucking tank.  Just me and Charlie, man, eyeball to eyeball.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's fuckin' combat.  The man in the black pyjamas, Dude.  Worthy fuckin' adversary.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Fuck you.  Fuck the three of you.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey, cool it Walter.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey, cool it Walter.  Listen, pal, there never was any money.  The big Lebowski gave me an empty briefcase, man, so take it up with him.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: AND I'D LIKE MY UNDIES BACK!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What's mine is mine.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Come on, Walter!.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hy God!  They shot him, Walter!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: They shot Donny!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: There weren't any shots.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Then what's...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It's a heart attack.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Wha.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Call the medics, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Wha. . . Donny--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Hurry Dude.  I'd go but I'm pumping blood.  Might pass out.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Walter Sobchak.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: The Dude, actually.  Is what, uh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well can we--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: A hundred and eighty dollars?!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: We're scattering the fucking ashes!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: JUST BECAUSE WE'RE BEREAVED DOESN'T MEAN WE'RE SAPS!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Goddamnit Walter!  You fucking asshole!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude!  Dude, I'm sorry!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You make everything a fucking travesty!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude, I'm--it was an accident!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What about that shit about Vietnam!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude, I'm sorry--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What the fuck does Vietnam have to do with anything!  What the fuck were you talking about?!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shit Dude, I'm sorry--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You're a fuck, Walter!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: WHERE'S THE FUCKING MONEY, SHITHEAD!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It's uh, it's down there somewhere. Lemme take another look.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Dude, this is Smokey.  Look, I don't wanna be a hard-on about this, and I know it wasn't your fault, but I just thought it was fair to tell you that Gene and I will be submitting this to the League and asking them to set aside the round.  Or maybe forfeit it to us--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: --so, like I say, just thought, you know, fair warning.  Tell Walter.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Dude here.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Dude the Bagman.  Where do you want us to go?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: ...Us? DUDE

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Shut the fuck up.  Hello?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Okay, listen--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Dude here.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Okay, vee proceed.  But only if there is no funny stuff.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: So no funny stuff.  Okay?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey, just tell me where the fuck you want us to go.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Dude.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You are approaching a vooden britch. When you cross it you srow ze bag from ze left vindow of ze moving kar.  Do not slow down.  Vee vatch you.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Another Caucasian, Gary.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Right, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Friends like these, huh Gary.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?  No, she, she hit me right here.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I understand sir.  Could you slide your shorts down please?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well sir, it's this rug I have, really tied the room together-

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: You told Brandt on the phone, he told me.  So where do I fit in?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well they were looking for you, these two guys, they were trying to--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: I'll say it again, all right?  You told Brandt.  He told me.  I know what happened. Yes?  Yes?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: So you know they were trying to piss on your rug--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Did I urinate on your rug?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You mean, did you personally come and pee on my--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Hello!  Do you speak English?  Parla usted Inglese?  I'll say it again. Did I urinate on your rug?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well no, like I said, Woo peed on the rug--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Hello!  Hello!  So every time--I just want to understand this, sir-- every time a rug is micturated upon in this fair city, I have to compensate the--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Come on, man, I'm not trying to scam anybody here, I'm just--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: You're just looking for a handout like every other--are you employed, Mr. Lebowski?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Look, let me explain something. I'm not Mr. Lebowski;  you're Mr. Lebowski.  I'm the Dude.  So that's what  you  call me.  That, or Duder. His  Dudeness.  Or El Duderino, if, you know, you're not into the whole brevity thing--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Are you employed, sir?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Employed?

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: You don't go out and make a living dressed like that in the middle of a weekday.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Is this a--what day is this?

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: But I do work, so if you don't mind--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No, look.  I do mind.  The Dude minds. This will not stand, ya know, this will not stand, man.  I mean, if your wife owes--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: My wife is not the issue here. I hope that my wife will someday learn to live on her allowance, which is ample, but if she doesn't, sir, that will be her problem, not mine, just as your rug is your problem, just as every bum's lot in life is his own responsibility regardless of whom he chooses to blame.  I didn't blame anyone for the loss of my legs, some chinaman in Korea took them from me but I went out and achieved anyway. I can't solve your problems, sir, only you can.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Ah fuck it.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Sure!  Fuck it!  That's your answer! Tattoo it on your forehead!  Your answer to everything!

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: It's funny.  I can look back on a life of achievement, on challenges met, competitors bested, obstacles overcome.  I've accomplished more than most men, and without the use of my legs.  What. . . What makes a man, Mr. Lebowski?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Dude.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I don't know, sir.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Is it. . . is it, being prepared to do the right thing?  Whatever the price?  Isn't that what makes a man?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Sure.  That and a pair of testicles.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Mind if I smoke a jay?

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Bunny.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: 'Scuse me?

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Bunny Lebowski. . . She is the light of my life.  Are you surprised at my tears, sir?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Fuckin' A.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Strong men also cry. . . Strong men also cry.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Where's my goddamn money, you bum?!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well we--I don't--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: They did not receive the money, you nitwit!  They  did not receive the goddamn money.  HER LIFE WAS IN YOUR HANDS!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: C'mon man, who're you gonna believe? Those guys are--we dropped off the damn money--

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: WHAT?!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I--the royal we, you know, the editorial--I dropped off the money, exactly as per--Look, I've got certain information, certain things have come to light, and uh, has it ever occurred to you, man, that given the nature of all this new shit, that, uh, instead of running around blaming me, that this whole thing might just be, not, you know, not just such a simple, but uh--you know?

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: What in God's holy name are you blathering about?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I'll tell you what I'm blathering about!  I got information--new shit has come to light and--shit, man! She kidnapped herself!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well sure, look at it!  Young trophy wife, I mean, in the parlance of our times, owes money all over town, including to known pornographers-- and that's cool, that's cool-- but I'm saying, she needs money, and of course they're gonna say they didn't get it 'cause she wants more, man, she's gotta feed the monkey, I mean-- hasn't that ever occurred to you...? Sir?

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: No.  No Mr. Lebowski, that had not occurred to me.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Brandt, give him the envelope.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well, okay, if you've already made out the check.  Brandt is handing him a letter-sized envelope which is distended by something inside.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Well, she's back.  No thanks to you.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Where's the money, Lebowski?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: We know the briefcase was empty, man.  We know you kept the million bucks yourself.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Well, you have your story, I have mine.  I say I entrusted the money to you, and you stole it.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Well?  Aren't you?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well. . . yeah.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: All right, get out.  Both of you.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Put me down, you son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter!

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: You monsters!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Help me put him back in his chair.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Who the hell is he?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'll tell you who I am!  I'm the guy who's gonna KICK YOUR PHONY GOLDBRICKING ASS!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Look at that fucking phony, Dude! Pretending to be a fucking millionaire!

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: I said out.  Now.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Let me tell you something else. I've seen a lot of spinals, Dude, and this guy is a fake.  A fucking goldbricker.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: This guy fucking walks.  I've never been more certain of anything in my life!

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Stay away from me, mister!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh, shit.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: You're bullies!  Cowards, both of you!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shit, sorry man.

turns.speaker: LEBOWSKI
turns.text: Stay away from me!  You bullies! You and these women!  You won't leave a man his fucking balls!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Smokey Huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Over the line, Smokey!  I'm sorry. That's a foul.

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: Bullshit.  Eight, Dude.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Excuse me!  Mark it zero.  Next frame.

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: Bullshit. Walter!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: This is not Nam.  This is bowling. There are rules.

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: Yeah, but--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Am I wrong!?

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: Yeah, but I wasn't over.  Gimme the marker, Dude,  I'm marking it an eight.

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: I'm not--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: A world of pain.

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: Walter--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: YOU THINK I'M FUCKING AROUND HERE? MARK IT ZERO!!

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: All right!  There it is!  It's fucking zero!

turns.speaker: SMOKEY
turns.text: You happy, you crazy fuck?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: This is a league game, Smokey!

turns.speaker: BUCKY
turns.text: You come all the way down here to roust--

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I came all the way down here same as you did.  Keep from gettin' killed. Happened to see those jarheads beatin' on a good collar--  Habla Ingles, Tomas?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Tom here's my ninth hard felon of the month. Six weeks he'll be sucking gas. In three years I'll be working Central Warrants. Jewboy Deputy D.A. over there wets his pants for fighters. Promised me the next spot he can wangle.

turns.speaker: BUCKY
turns.text: Impressive.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Wanna hear something more impressive? My first twenty fights were stumblebums handpicked by my manager. My girlfriend saw you fight a couple times over at the Olympic. Says maybe you could take me.

turns.speaker: BUCKY
turns.text: Whatta we do about the Mex?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: We'll take 'em in the morning.

turns.speaker: BUCKY
turns.text: You'll take him.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: He's half yours, partner.

turns.speaker: BUCKY
turns.text: He's all yours. And I'm not your partner.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Someday.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: They tell bedtime stories about you. Blade the big, bad boogie-man.  Frankly, I'm disappointed.  That you were willing to come along so easily, I mean.  Without any assurances.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Survival.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Seems like he's doing me a favor, then.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: You're missing the point.  Their vampire victims don't die.  They turn.  They become carriers.  If the Reapers continue unchecked, there could be thousands of them before the month is over.  Do the math.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Two years.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Then they weren't created to go after your "patient zero".

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: No.  They've been training to hunt you.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You've been training two years to take me out.  Here I am, the big, bad vampire hunter.  So do it.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: What the hell are you doing, Blade?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: We're going to be working as a unit, you people will be taking orders from me.  So let's get it over with.  I'll give you a free shot, Reinhardt.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Where to first?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: The House of Pain.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: This is our world you're entering.  You may see things -- feeding.  Just remember why you're here.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I haven't forgotten.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What is it with you people and pain?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: We need it.  Sensations are addictive and pain cuts the deepest.  Tattoos, piercings, tribal scarring -- because we regenerate, none of it's permanent.  So we have to take it to the next level. To remind us we're alive.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: You're hurt.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I'll heal.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: What about Nomak?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: He escaped.  You didn't tell me they were immune to silver and garlic.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: I didn't know.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: how long since he was bitten?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Minutes.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Recognize him?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: From the surveillance footage in the bloodbank.  He was one of the guard's Nomak attacked.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Which means he turned about seventy-two hours ago.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Right.  So why is he dying?  He doesn't appear to have any broken bones, no entry wounds of any kind -- what's killing him?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Time.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: No hemoglobin left. Their metabolisms are too fast.  They burn out.  That's why they're having to feed so often.  Their systems are self destructing.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: If that's true, what about Nomak?  He's been alive longer than the others.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Nomak's different.  He's the carrier.  There's something driving him beyond the Thirst.  Something we're missing.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: I've never seen anything like this.  The Reapers are as different from us as we are from you.  It's almost as if the virus is re-wiring their bodies, creating new, parasitic organs which consume the old ones.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Like cancer with a purpose.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Exactly.  Look at the digestive system. It's been drastically simplified.  Super charged.  And this --

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: He's right about one thing.  We do have to survive.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You don't have to hunt to do it.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Really?  What are we supposed to do, then?  Starve ourselves because we fee on others in order to live?  What about that scumbag you just let off the hook? A nothing.  A drug-dealer.  How do you justify saving people like that?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Blade.  We've got six Reapers.  They're all dead.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Fry 'em.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Blade.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Save it.  I don't want to hear your words.  Let's do this NOW!!!

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Each day is a little life.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: "Each day is a little life.  Every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death."

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Anyone else make it?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: It would've been easy for you to let me die back there today, but you didn't.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I wouldn't read too much into it.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You don't want to go there.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Because one of us is going to kill the other before this ends.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: It doesn't have to be like that.  We don't have to be enemies.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Get real.  I was useful to Damaskinos as long as the hunt was still on.  Now that it's over, all bets are off.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: If that's true, then why'd you save me?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Why do you hate us so much?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I am a hunter.  A weapon.  It's what I do.  It's in my blood.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Well it's in mine, too.  I'm a pureblood.  I wasn't turned.  I was born this way.  Just like you.  Am I evil because I want to survive?  What about a wolf?  What about any predator?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: You're hurting me.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Pain cuts the deepest, isn't that what you said?
